task.name: Check input LidoFlight xml
task.description:
Check input Lido Flight against FE Pool
(reason: currently the Exit/Entry points coordinates have incorrect format and not all ETOPs are listed in Arinc633 xml)
Address those issues as a LidoFlight TroubleTicket.
Skills: ETOPS knowledge.
task.notes:
Dear Customer,
The following ticket has been issued:
T1203833 - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - Title: ------ RepGen issue - Arinc633 - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - Impact: ------- Medium - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - Description: ---------------- Hello HD, please open a trouble ticket and assign it to GDN. This is an RepGen issue concerning the generatino of ARINC633 messages. Would you inform me about the ticket number.
Error description:
Please check that </PositionName> is not missing in ETOPS case: Wrong: <ETOPSSummary ruleTime="PT03H00M00S" borderTime="PT01H00M00S" > <CriticalPositions> <CriticalPosition> <PositionName>ENTRY1
Correct: <ETOPSSummary ruleTime="PT03H00M00S" borderTime="PT01H00M00S" > <CriticalPositions> <CriticalPosition> <PositionName>ENTRY1</PositionName>
Please use condition values from the list below: Wrong: <Condition>decompression with one engine out</Condition>
correct <Condition>decompressionOneEngineOut</Condition>
Please check that all <CriticalPositions> are generated (for all Conditions) and the <Condition> values must be according the list below: Condition - possible values: decompressionOneEngineOut decompression oneEngineOut twoEnginesOut
Please change the airportFunction in case of ETOPS: Wrong: <SuitableAirport> <Airport airportFunction="SuitableAirport">
Correct: <SuitableAirport> <Airport airportFunction="ETOPSSuitableAirport">
Always put Numbering on the ENTRY and EXIT points: wrong: <ETOPSSummary ruleTime="PT03H00M00S" borderTime="PT01H00M00S" > <CriticalPositions> <CriticalPosition> <PositionName>ENTRY</PositionName>
correct: <ETOPSSummary ruleTime="PT03H00M00S" borderTime="PT01H00M00S" > <CriticalPositions> <CriticalPosition> <PositionName>ENTRY1</PositionName>
wrong: <ETOPSSummary ruleTime="PT03H00M00S" borderTime="PT01H00M00S" > <CriticalPositions> <CriticalPosition> <PositionName>EXIT</PositionName>
correct: <ETOPSSummary ruleTime="PT03H00M00S" borderTime="PT01H00M00S" > <CriticalPositions> <CriticalPosition> <PositionName>EXIT1</PositionName>
Please check the Coordinate values in ETOPS case, they are not correct: <ETOPSSummary ruleTime="PT03H00M00S" borderTime="PT01H00M00S" > <CriticalPositions> <CriticalPosition> <PositionName>ENTRY</PositionName> <Coordinates latitude="14D0025N" longitude="0520116E" />
End of Error description.

task.name: Interface: module test
task.description: Check working of the new interface.
task.notes:
skills: PIREP Interface, PIREP data flow
Done.
TESTCASE: 1) Check if PIREPInterface is running ("ps -ef|grep PIREP"). If yes then "stop_PIREPInterface.sh". 2) Create out_pirep directory in home directory. 3) Edit $FLTWINDS_HOME_DIR/config/PIREPInterface.properties file (outputDir property) It should be set to "outputDir=/home/fltwinds/out_pirep". 4) Run PIREPInterface "start_PIREPInterface.sh &". 5) Go to $HOME/mqscripts. You can find there scripts for PIREP MQ handling, and 3 examples. "./putPirepMqm.sh -i example1.xml -q in". Do the same with example2 and example3. 6) Check $HOME/out_pirep directory. There will be 3 ASCII PIREP messages, converted from input XML examples.

task.name: Check airdec processing
task.description: Check if the simulation with prepared PIREP test message is possible using airdec.
task.notes:
Skills: PIREP data flow, airdec, C
Done: works!
Steps to process a PIREP (on demoserver):
1. in /opt/fltwinds/net-1/flt/fltwinds/draszy1 you can find artificall PIREP filled with spaces instead of nonprintable characters (PIREP_SPC). To make it useable you must change the dates which is in unix format. Dates strings starts from index 505. You can use http://www.onlineconversion.com/unix_time.htm for time conversion. The new time should be near the current past in GMT time. In subdirectory examples you can find more PIREPs and AIREPs, but with nonprintable characters. Hovewer this is not a problem, you can edit them as the example with spaces.
2. If you put some free text on the beginning please remember that the lenght of free text field is fixed. This means that you must delete the same number of characters as you insert. i.e. "AAAA " is the original string, and you change it to "AAAA BBB ". This will not work because the length of the field changed. Thus you must change it to "AAAA BBB " - now the length is the same as original.
3. If you now have your PIREP ready, then put it into /data1/staging/alpha2/ directory. 4. Check if your PIREP is processed in /data1/alpha_newdb/AIRCRAFT_CONTENT file. 5. Wait (usually 5 min) for the PIREP to display in the client.

task.description:
Extend Abstract Interface Daemon to move message on a reject queue (if configured) in case some interface throws a ConversionException.
Background: Existing interfaces (e.g. AlertInterface) have no real error/exception handling. Currently we just get an log-file entry and the message will be sent to the fltsvr anyhow.

task.name: Lido/Flight: Check office creation steps
task.description: Check how offices are created in Lido/Flight and confirm that we can define numeric offices.
task.notes:
Skills: Lido/Flight
In Lido/Flight office must be an airport. It is possible to create 001 waypoint but first dummy airport must be created.
Steps: 1. Create 001 waypoint in waypoint frame. 2. Add IATA code for that waypoint but in airport frame. 3. In flightlist try to move some flight to that new office.
Done.

On the Review-Server was an additional Problem: The AsdiParser could not start, because the primary-server-port (10009 in this case) was blocked by tomcat, so AsdiParser could not listen on that port.
Still open: The build-server can't connect to any port because of still existing firewall problems.

task.name: Collect OTS sample data
task.description: Produce example content Skills: Lido Flight Interface knowledge MQ knowledge
task.notes:
Proceed these steps on some Lido/Flight env.
0. ps -ef|grep TRCK If InterfaceTRCK is working, then go directly to step 2.
1. Type Start_TRCKInterface.ksh 2. After some time in OutboundTRCK (1512), you shall see some messages. You can check it by "qstat -s 1512" 3. You can write messages to the file by "qadmin -K 1512:100 > some_file". In this example 100 is number of messages you want to write.
I attached extracted output from OutboundTRCK queue.

story.name: OFPs_Data
story.description:
As a Dispatcher
I want to see all Lido/Flight calculated Flight Plans for a given flight leg in the Flight Plan Tab of the FltWinds application and be able to select any operational Flight Plan avialable in the flight plan calculator (multiple choices possible)
So I can see the following information produced and recieved from Lido/Flight (Route nem, OFP#, CI, cost, FltTime?, burn, bolck, ETA, distance) for all flights of the flight leg and for the selected operation Flight Plan I can see the route details in the Flight Plan Tab .

task.name: Analysis of handling waypoints in FltWinds
task.description:
Tracks coordinates are specified in Waypoints and/or different type of coordinates - discover how FltWinds handles this data
Outcome: Wiki page
Skills: Fltwinds Client knowledge, Java
task.notes: Done. FltWinds accepts different formats of coordinates. Handling of such formats can be done by TLcdLonLatParser and TLcdLonLatPointFormat classes. Format of coordinates which are output from Lido/Flight should be acceptable for FltWinds. If any additional calculations are necessary then it should be done in client, because of availability of Luciad classes. OTSInterface needs customization which will differ coordinates from normal waypoints in the tracks. Thus, new element "otsCoordinate" must be introduced in OTS schema. The type of that element will be new (as simple as possible), because none of the types introduced in the "common schemas" will cover the content of the element. Additional calculation of coordinates is not an option in the interface, because there is no usefull classes for that, and morover, in the client the recalculation would be done again (which is stupid and error prone), that's why the new type is the most accurate solution.

task.name: Problem in FltWinds start scripts with ARINC633 and ACARS interfaces
task.description:
there's obviously a problem in the start scripts, e.g
fltwinds-ifc_in-acars.sh start
does not work correctly if fltwinds-ifc_in-acars-pos has been started before. The cause is that in-acars matches both interfaces.
Do you have time to fix this?
Hint: You may want to use perl instead of grep for more precise pattern matching like list=`ps -ef | perl -n -e "print \$_ if ( /$bin\\s/ && ! /grep/ )" ` instead of list=`ps -ef | grep -v grep | grep ${bin}`

task.name: Implement MQ script for Q-duplication
task.description: Write a perl script to duplicate of all required FltWinds queues on QLHACC09 / GDNDATAHUB for use at another environment (CBS, personnel)
task.notes:
Info from Jarek:
You need: - topic - alias queue to the topic - destination queues - for each destination queue a subscription for the topic If messages should be ALSO available on FLTWND.TEST.REVIEW.FLTWND.ARINC.IN then you need 3 queues and 3 subscriptions. There is no 'source queue'. Or rather - there is, but on QLHACC and QLHLH, from where messages are sent to QLHACC09. I need to change the definition already done on QLHLH for that. The 'script' for QLHACC09 would be:
def topic(PUBLISH.FLTWND.ARINC) topicstr(FLTWND.ARINC.STR) PMSGDLV(ALL) replace def qa(PUBLISH.FLTWND.ARINC) TARGTYPE(TOPIC) TARGET(PUBLISH.FLTWND.ARINC) replace
def ql(FLTWND.TEST.CBS.FLTWND.ARINC.IN) replace def ql(FLTWND.TEST.DITCAR1.FLTWND.ARINC.IN) replace
def sub(FLTWND.TEST.CBS.FLTWND.ARINC.IN) topicstr('') topicobj(PUBLISH.FLTWND.ARINC) DEST(FLTWND.TEST.CBS.FLTWND.ARINC.IN) def sub(FLTWND.TEST.DITCAR1.FLTWND.ARINC.IN) topicstr('') topicobj(PUBLISH.FLTWND.ARINC) DEST(FLTWND.TEST.DITCAR1.FLTWND.ARINC.IN) def sub(FLTWND.TEST.REVIEW.FLTWND.ARINC.IN) topicstr('') topicobj(PUBLISH.FLTWND.ARINC) DEST(FLTWND.TEST.DITCAR1.FLTWND.ARINC.IN)
